_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The United Suppliers, Inc. ? Silver Creek, Ne operation is committed to employee, public and environmental safety.  This commitment is demonstrated by continually improving both practices and measures to prevent the release of regulated substances.  In the event of a release, the Silver Creek facility is prepared to work with the Merrick County LEPC and/or other authorities to mitigate any release and minimize the impact to people and the environment.

The Silver Creek facility's primary covered process activity is the mixing of fertilizers.  These activities include storage and processing of anhydrous ammonia.  Anhydrous ammonia is received, stored and processed into 10-34-0 non-hazardous liquid fertilizer.  Processing is periodic and usually occurs in the Spring and Fall.  Ammonia mixing with phosphoric acid occurs in a T-reactor. The T reactor is usually a contractor operation that is controlled by the contractor.   Water is used as both a reaction feed material and product stabilizer.  The Emergency Response Procedures for Silver Creek are coordinated with the Merrick County LEPC.

United Suppliers Inc--Silver Creek Ne. facility follows the provisions of the U. S. Occupational Safety and Health Administrations (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910 111 and 29 CFR 1910 119, "Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia" and the State  regulations covering anhydrous ammonia.


Five (5) Year Accident History:  There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five (5) years that have resulted in deaths, injuries or significant property damage.  Nor to our knowledge, has there been any releases resulting in off-site deaths, injuries, evacuations, property damage and/or environmental damage.

Emergency Action Plan:  United Suppliers, Inc. ? Silver Creek, Ne has a written emergency action plan.  This plan includes notification of the Merrick County LEPC to respond to a major release as United Suppliers, Inc -- Silver Creek, Ne does not plan on responding to a major re

lease.  Local authorities have been provided with emergency planning and community right-to-know information.

Planned changes to improve safety:  United Suppliers, Inc. ? Silver Creek, Ne views safety improvement as a continual process.  Periodic evaluations (both internal and external) are performed to assess the facility status.  At this time, and aside from sustaining maintenance activities, there are no additional specific safety recommendations regarding anhydrous ammonia.
